review: Getting the verification code from our cable provider was a nightmare for some of the apps. This probably isn't on Amazon, but it was still a hassle. For streaming, sometimes the quality dips in and out, moreso than on other devices we have in the home, again, this could be an internet/throttling issue. Set up was easy, my parents have been able to figure it out and use it.
author: Jake Chak

review: Our new favorite gadget! Bought this to make it easier to view Netflix and Hulu, and to also gain access to our Amazon Prime video benefits. We've had this for 3 months now and use it religiously. It's so easy to navigate and there's never an issue with buffering or anything. With the Amazon Fire TV, I can actually see us comfortably getting rid of our cable altogether. We'll just have to go a nearby bar to watch live sports, which doesn't really sound like a downfall.
author: Amazon Customer

review: Good hardware but awful software. The user interface is a mess. Apps installed always have some problems. I can't believe Amazon rolled out a product like this. I have to reboot the device couple of times a week. I have Roku for many years and it is very user friendly and stable. fire TV has usb but you can't connect a external hard drive for it. You can connect a mouse but amazon interface doesn't support it. voice search is very limited. The only good side is I can enable the develop mode to install 3rd party apps which are much useful than the original one.
author: D. Lu
